page.title: 01SUMMARY
page.content: {This flat area almost entirely agri_ {cultural}covers most of Ashwellthorpe & Wreningham,parts of Fundenhall & Sil _field.There are 3 managed woods _ sporting ash being used for sports equipment.Modern houses amongst timber framed & clay lump dwellings form settlement areas with scattered farms producing barley,wheat,oats,oil_seed rape,sprouts,potatoes & sugar_beet, grown largely with artificial manures & kept weed,fungus & insect_free by chemicals.Porous plastic piping is be_ ing used for land drainage.Many hedge_ rows have been removed;those remaining often with semi_ & mature oaks at intervals.A long family tradition in Wreningham is the rearing & showing of ponies & young hunters which has given the Bothway family national fame.The River Tiffey rises in Ashwellthorpe.A dismantled railway crosses Wreningham.
